shows.title: King James Bible / Dreams & Nightmares
shows.first_half: First Half: Truck driver and biblical scholar David Jenkins will discuss the King James Bible, its meanings, and its influences in modern life. He'll also explain why the Dead Sea Scrolls were not used in the King James version.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and psychiatrist Dr. Greg Mahr will bring us his research on dreams and nightmares. Dreams help us heal from trauma and deliver important messages from deep within us, he believes, and we can develop a relationship with our dream world that can help us grow in strength and wisdom.

shows.title: Law of Attraction / The Ghostly Realm
shows.first_half: First Half: Coach, author, and ordained minister Felicia Searcy will discuss how the Law of Attraction is more than just positive thinking, but also a spiritual law that, when understood and applied, can transform our lives. She'll share why many people struggle to make it work consistently, and how a clear, soul-aligned vision is the true starting point.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Ghost hunter Ross Allison will delve into ghost stories, his personal experiences, and why everyone wants their dish of spooky just in time for the Halloween season. He'll reveal what fascinates and draws people to the realm of ghosts.

shows.title: Impact of Assassinations / Palmistry Insights
shows.first_half: First Half: In the wake of the shooting of media personality, Charlie Kirk, psychiatrist Carole Lieberman, M.D., will discuss assassinations and the impact they can have on Americans and their psyches. She feels that America has gone from ‘Cancel Culture’ to ‘Assassination Nation,' but with a few modifications we can get back on track.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Palmist Vernon Mahabal will talk about how a person's palms can reveal a lot about them and their character. He'll delve into coming economic and social trends that he sees when reading palms and share how your palms can dictate certain aspects of your life.

shows.title: New Mars Evidence / Crop Circles & the Paranormal
shows.first_half: First Half: Dr. Gerard van Belle is the Director of Science at the Lowell Observatory, and an expert in the design and construction of optical telescope arrays. He'll discuss the recent data from NASA’s Perseverance rover on Mars, which has provided evidence of possible ancient life on the red planet.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones presents her interview with filmmaker and ufologist Jennifer Stein, delving into her explorations of the mysterious crop circle phenomenon. Stein also recounts her paranormal experiences, and the inspiration of her friendship with the late astronaut Edgar Mitchell.

shows.title: The Heart Code / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Joining guest host Connie Willis (info), Dr. Bradley Nelson unpacks research confirming that the heart is more than a muscle or pump; it’s the center of our emotional being. He explains how "heartbreak" can harm our health, relationships, and our ability to thrive and achieve success, and reveals keys to healing a broken heart from his new book, "The Heart Code." Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Connie a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
